intro: Streptolophus, commonly known as the marsh orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, often violet or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in wet or marshy habitats, such as bogs and wet meadows, across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. Streptolophus species are known for their intricate floral structures and specialized pollination mechanisms. They play an important role in wetland ecosystems and are often indicators of habitat health.
